titleStmt.title: Howard Douglass to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG2038

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1863-1867

body.p:
Office of JOHN G. DOUGLASS,
Attorney & Counsellor,
NO. 44 WEST FOURTH STREET.
Cincinnati, February 12" 1865.
Hon Thos E. Bramlette
Frankfort Kentucky.
I am desirous of a commission for Kentucky for the acknowledgment of deeds.
My father has been Commissioner for the last fifteen years.
Being most of his time in Court it would be desirable that I should have a commission, in case your honor should think it advisable, as most of the Kentucky deeds are acknowledged in our office.
I am studying law. If my age nineteen interferes I do not desire it.
If it can be granted it will oblige

Ohio
Comr Deeds
H. Douglass
Comd
14th Feby/65
